Package structure

Class RosterManager

java.lang.Object
structure.RosterManager
public class RosterManager extends Object
Implements the RosterManager class to take care of the roster and make changes to the roster. Processes all console inputs and outputs a response to the console.
Author:
Nikhil Agarwal, Hyeon Oh

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      this is a method that will continuously run the program until the user inputs in a "Q" to terminate the program. A -> add student Ex: A John Doe 1/20/2003 EE 80 R -> remove student Ex: R John Doe 1/20/2003 P -> print sorted roster (lname, fname, DoB) PS -> print sorted roster (standing) PC -> print sorted roster (school, major) L -> print list of student in roster from a specified school sorted (lname, fname, DoB) Ex: L SAS C -> change student major Ex: C John Doe 1/20/2003 CS Q -> terminate program this method will be used in RunProject1.java (Driver class)

    • processLine

      private String[] processLine(String command)
      uses string methods such as split to take inputs separately
      Parameters:
      command - the command which is taken to be split
      Returns:
      newLine which is a string array that returns the commands

    • processSchoolList

      private void processSchoolList(String[] tokens, Roster roster)
      Processes the school list
      Parameters:
      tokens - string array that is taken from command line from the user
      roster - the roster object that has all students currently @Rutgers, students will be added to a school list from this roster.

    • processChange

      private void processChange(String[] tokens, Roster roster)
      Changes a student's major if the student is found the roster and the major they want to change too is valid.
      Parameters:
      tokens - string array that is taken from the command line from the user
      roster - the roster object that will be searched to find a specific student.

    • processPrintMajor

      private void processPrintMajor(Roster roster)
      Displays the roster sorted by school, major
      Parameters:
      roster - the argument that is to be displayed

    • processPrintStanding

      private void processPrintStanding(Roster roster)
      Displays the roster sorted by standing by calling printByStanding method from the roster class If the roster is empty, it will display to the user that it is empty
      Parameters:
      roster - the argument that is to be displayed

    • processPrint

      private void processPrint(Roster roster, int typeOfRoster, String school)
      Displays to the user whether the roster or list is empty, and displays the roster
      Parameters:
      roster - argument used to determine if the roster is empty and also used to call print method from roster class
      typeOfRoster - type of roster (Full student roster, school specific roster).
      school - if the type of roster is a school list, the school of the list will be input, otherwise this parameter is an empty string.

    • processRemove

      private void processRemove(String[] tokens, Roster roster)
      Used to remove a student from the roster
      Parameters:
      tokens - input taken from the user at the command line
      roster - roster object that the student object will be removed from.

    • processAdd

      private void processAdd(String[] tokens, Roster roster)
      Used to add a student to the roster, checks to see if student is a valid student.
      Parameters:
      tokens - string array that is taken from the command line from the user .
      roster - roster object that the student object will be added too.

    • grabMajor

      private Major grabMajor(String[] tokens)
      Checks to see if a given console input matches a valid major in enum class Major.
      Parameters:
      tokens - string array which is taken from the command line from the user
      Returns:
      major returns the major, null if major is not valid.
